newsitem.title: USA: Cusiana loadings at 14-15 cargoes in Sept - trader.
newsitem.headline: Cusiana loadings at 14-15 cargoes in Sept - trader.

text.p: The number of loadings of Colombian Cusiana crude oil planned for September is 14 to 15 cargoes, up four to five cargoes from the August schedule, a trader said on Monday.

The increase partly reflects higher-than-expected production of the gasoline-rich grade. Output is projected to average 340,000 barrels per day (bpd), up from earlier predictions of 280,000 to 330,000 bpd.

At the same time, local demand for Cusiana is on the low side of previous projections. The Barrancabermeja refinery is expected to utilize about 40,000 bpd of Cusiana, out of a normal range of 40,000 t0 55,000 bpd, the trader said.
Out of the 14-15 planned cargoes, equity producers British Petroleum and Total of France have five and two cargoes, respectively.
Colombian state oil company Ecopetrol has the balance, including a cross-month cargo scheduled to load between September 29 and October 3.
The first loading, which belongs to BP, is scheduled for September 3-7.

Even before the schedule came out late Friday night, Ecopetrol last week sold a cargo loading in the first decade of September to a U.S. refiner at 65 cents a barrel under benchmark West Texas Intermediate/Cushing on an fob basis.
Sellers are now asking around 55 cents under the benchmark, the trader said.

Cusiana liftings have been rising steadily in recent months in line with growing production. Loadings climbed from an average of around seven cargoes a month until August, when they rose to 10 cargoes, including a cross-month cargo belonging to Ecopetrol.
All of the August cargoes have been placed with U.S. refiners.
BP operates the Cusiana/Cupiagua oil field complex in the Andes foothills region of Colombia.
BP's partners are Ecopetrol, Total and U.S. independent Triton.
